meanings.definition: To surpass in numbers or popularity.
meanings.sent1: The small bakery outcrowds the big chain in quality.
meanings.sent2: The new movie outcrowds all others at the box office.
meanings.sent3: The underdog team outcrowds the reigning champions in the final match.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outcrowds any material possessions.
meanings.sent5: The bright sun outcrowds the dim stars in the night sky.

meanings.definition: The group of people who are not part of the main crowd or majority.
meanings.sent1: The outcrowds gathered at the park for a peaceful protest.
meanings.sent2: She always felt like part of the outcrowds in school.
meanings.sent3: The outcrowds brought a unique perspective to the discussion.
meanings.sent4: The outcrowds cheered loudly from the sidelines.
meanings.sent5: The outcrowds added diversity to the event.
